title: BBC Breakfast viewers 'switch off' as they fume 'enough now'
description: BBC Breakfast viewers issued the same complaint during an interview on Tuesday's show
content:
BBC Breakfast viewers claimed to "switch off" as they fumed over a controversial interview on Tuesday (August 12). During today's edition of the hit morning programme, hosts Jon Kay and Sarah Campbell updated viewers with the latest news from across the UK and around the world. John Watson was also in the studio to present the sports segment, while Carol Kirkwood delivered regular weather updates live from a sunflower field in Milton Keynes. Ahead of the publication of her new memoir, Jon and Sarah welcomed former First Minister of Scotland Nicola Sturgeon to the studio. During the interview, Nicola reflected on the day of her arrest in 2023, as well as her sexuality, miscarriage, and past handling of legislation.

However, several BBC viewers weren't impressed with the length of the interview, with many taking to X (formerly Twitter) to share their frustration. "Just turned #BBCBreakfast off. Why are they giving more airtime to Sturgeon?" one person wrote, with another adding: "This interview with Sturgeon is a waste of time #BBCBreakfast. Apart from the break for the 'local' news, we've had 30 mins of in studio interviews... No news?" A third said, "Seriously, that's enough now." summary: BBC Breakfast viewers are angry over a controversial interview with former First Minister of Scotland, Nicola Sturgeon, which took place on the show on August 12. The interview was conducted ahead of the publication of Sturgeon's new memoir. Many viewers took to social media to express their dissatisfaction with the length of the interview, which they believe is excessive.
shortSummary: BBC Breakfast viewers "switch off" during a controversial interview with Nicola Sturgeon, criticizing the length as uninspiring.

The segment sparked a significant reaction, leading some to switch off the program.
